sub_title: Director @ BAM Infra Nederland | Director Commercial Business Development
summary:
I have over 25 years of invaluable experience in civil engineering, asset management, and business development, and I am currently spearheading the commercial and business development activities at BAM Infra Nederland, a powerhouse in the construction and civil engineering industry in Europe.

My mission is clear: to achieve a healthy financial and sustainable outcome not just for our company but also for our valued clients. To achieve this, I am committed to diversifying, improving, and transforming our business in close collaboration with our partners and stakeholders.

As a passionate leader and strategic thinker, I harness my expertise in sustainable development, innovation, and growth to identify and create market opportunities. I take pride in developing cutting-edge concepts and propositions that align with the ever-evolving demands of the industry. Additionally, I optimize design and construction processes to ensure we deliver the highest standards of quality and efficiency.

At the core of my approach is a deep commitment to sustainability, ensuring that our projects have a positive impact on the environment and communities we serve. With an unwavering focus on excellence and a forward-looking mindset, I am dedicated to steering BAM Infra Nederland towards continued success and pioneering advancements within the construction industry.

education.field_of_study: Mathematics, Physics, Biology, German, English, Netherlands, History

awards.title: Runner-up for the Prins Friso Award for ‘Engineer of the Year’ 2018
awards.description:
Jury report: “The runner-up for the Prince Friso Engineers price 2018 is MSc. BSc. Sander den Blanken RO (44), Managing Director of Arup Netherlands. Sander den Blanken is recognized for his ability to capitalize on the need and the social impact of innovation of materials and new application for circular solutions. Sander den Blanken is also recognized for his contributions to knowledge sharing platforms like Steel Bridges, initiated by TNO and Delft University of technology, in order to share his expertise and experience with the wider engineering community.”
https://lnkd.in/e5j53dJ
awards.issuer: Dutch Royal Institute of Engineers (www.kivi.nl), De Ingenieur

awards.title: National Steel Construction Award 2016
awards.description:
Palace Bridge in s-Hertogenbosch, the Netherlands, has won the National Steel Award 2016 in the Infrastructure category. Arup provided multidisciplinary services to this bridge designed by Benthem Crouwel Architects and executed by Mobilis.

Palace Bridge connects Den Bosch’ historic city center with the Palace Quarter in the south of the city. This new crossing over the railroad tracks creates a fast and social connection, which opens opportunities for further development of the Palace quarter.

Arup provided the Program of Requirements, 3D-frame calculations and constructive preliminary design and was responsible for the lighting design, equipment, foundations and optimization of design, construction plan and construction method.

"The Palace Bridge has become an emotional connection that transcends belief with its primary functionality. The districts are not connected through a simple puncture, but programmatically enriched with an elevated park and recreational area that actually attracts visitors and users. The Palace Bridge fascinates both professionals and local residents. The corten steel has a human scale, enhanced by the tight detailing as is only possible in steel. Technical solutions, such as the heated surface to prevent corrosion increasing road salt, are commendable. Performing the steel truss, which spans 45 meters, above deck creates not just structural expression, but also a logical divide between the different traffic flows. A winner par excellence".

—The National Steel Award jury

The National Steel Award was founded in 1971. The Dutch Building with Steel foundation recognizes projects with this award bi-annually. The nominees for 2016’s election were projects that were delivered and/or opened in 2014 and 2015.
awards.issuer: National Steel Association / Bouwen met Staal

projects.title: Galecopper bridge, Utrecht, the Netherlands (cable-stayed bridge)
projects.description: As part of the Galecopper bridge renovation, an extensive geotechnical assessment of the existing foundations/substructure (peine walls: interlocked driven steel H-piles perpendicular to the Amsterdam-Rhine canal) and design of the new foundation elements was carried out. Responsible for the desk study, ground investigation and geotechnical design report for the final design stage. This bridge carries the A12/A27 motorway over the Amsterdam-Rhine canal as part of the Utrecht motorway ring and it is owned and operated by Rijkswaterstaat (Dutch Ministry of Infrastructure and the Environment).

projects.title: International Bridge Design Competition “Kruunusillat Bridge”, Helsinki, Finland
projects.description: Project Director for a 2.5km Light Rail and Pedestrian/Bicycle Bridge between Helsinki and a future development in Kruunuvuorenranta has been proposed. Arup has developed a scheme design based on an innovative design approach based on “Infrastructure Sustainability” covering more than a hundred parameters divided into Social, Economic, Environmental, and Natural Resources. The bridge structure shows strong similarities to a Balanced Cantilever Structure but with interesting asymmetries. We have joined effort with UNStudio and FCG (Finish Consulting Group).

profile_positions.description:
Directing the commercial, business development activities to achieve a healthy financial and sustainable result of BAM Infra Netherlands. 

Diversify, sustainably grow, improve and transform the business in collaboration with the business, our customers and comakers to financially healthy business. 

Bringing together and effectively working together the business excellence and commercial activities within BAM Infra Netherlands and thus guaranteeing the continuity of the segment. 

Identifying and creating market opportunities and guaranteeing the continuity of business and cooperation. Initiating, coordinating and professionalising the development of concepts and propositions and the necessary innovations for the identified social themes and tasks. Successfully marketing these concepts and propositions. 

Substantiating and jointly making strategic and operational business decisions based on relevant and insightful information from internal and external, structured data. Continuously improve the learning capacity of the organization based on improvement and development programs. 

Leading the departments: Field Coaching, Business Intelligence, Marketing & Sales, Business Development & Innovation, Strategy & Improvement Programs, Tender Strategy, Stakeholder Management/ Permitting & Ecology, Sustainability, Traffic Management, Patent management and functionally responsible for the account management of the 12 Key Accounts and Development Accounts of BAM Infra Netherlands. As Director member of the Management Team of BAM Infra Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Director Commercial Business Development

profile_positions.description: As Managing Director end responsible for 95 people strong BAM Infra Asset Management company with Asset Management, Maintenance Engineering, Inspection and Digital Services.
profile_positions.title: Managing Director BAM Infra Asset Management

profile_positions.description:
As Managing Director end-responsible for a 500 people strong civil engineering company with all relevant management clusters: Design (Civil, Geotech, Maritime Structures, Railways, Technical Installations, Water, Highways), Project Integration (BIM, GIS, Risk management, SE, Digital Construction, Improvement Programs), and Strategic Advice (Soil Surveying, Business Support, Sustainable Development, Material Technology, Environmental Advice, Stakeholder Management, Tender Strategy, Traffic management), and a strong integrated Operational Design Management team, all to serve BAM Infra and BAM International. 

We focus on a seamless integration of design and construction. We maximize the potential during the design stage by applying both innovative solutions where needed, and also thorough craftsmanship to deliver the best possible outcomes for our clients. We maximize the reliability of construction by digital checks, simulations and artificial simulation. We deliver digitally, before we actually start construction.

Our people are located at our home base in Gouda, and several teams are co-located in Amsterdam, Apeldoorn, Breda, Culemborg, Den Haag, Drachten, Jakarta, Singapore, and Utrecht. 

BAM Infra Nederland has a flat organisational structure with several business units. BAM Infra Multidisciplinary Contracts is responsible for projects worth more than thirty million euros. The local markets are served through BAM Infra Regions. BAM Infra Connect – which includes BAM Infra Telecom, BAM Infra Energy & Water and BAM Infra Rail - works mainly for network managers and for providers and cable companies. One of the largest engineering firms in the Netherlands, BAM Infraconsult collects all the acquired knowledge and is active both in the Netherlands and abroad. With its head office in Gouda, this operating company has a broad network of branch offices at its disposal.
https://www.baminfra.nl/home
profile_positions.title: Directeur | Managing Director BAM Infraconsult

Responsible for developing the Highways Business in Scandinavian countries Norway, Sweden and Finland in close conjunction with the Denmark group leadership in the coming years, recognizing the important of this business to the region.
profile_positions.title: Director | Northern European Highways Business Leadership

profile_positions.description:
As Group Leader of Arup bv I am responsible for all activities of Arup in the Netherlands.

Our high level focus is based on the following vision:
“For our clients and projects we deliver the best possible technical and sustainable quality designs in a challenging and innovative environment that attracts the best people.” 

In order of priority, the Netherlands Group’s Strategy follows five key points:

Our People: We strive to have the best people in the market so we can deliver top quality design solutions to our clients. 

Our Clients : We strive to satisfy our Clients, because our Clients are central to our business.

Our Quality & Total Design: We strive to be a centre of excellence and meet the demand for sustainable integral design solutions for our clients.

Our Markets & Business: We strive to add value to our markets and businesses.

Innovation: We strive to innovate in our projects to inspire our people and clients, to stay ahead of competition and assure our quality.
profile_positions.title: Director | Group Leader The Netherlands

profile_positions.description:
Arup’s core values which I subscribe and try to embody, maintain the vision established by Sir Ove Arup (1895-1988):
• We will ensure that the Arup name is always associated with quality.
• We will act honestly and fairly in dealings with our staff and others.
• We will enhance prosperity for all Arup staff.

Our priorities are:
• our clients and our industry
• our creativity
• our people
• sustainable development.

We shape a better world:
• to enhance prosperity and the quality of life
• to deliver real value
• to have the freedom to be creative and to learn.

As Director I am responsible for:

- The project management of the Renovation of the Galecopperbridge as representative of Rijkswaterstaat, the Netherlands;
- The practice leadership of the Bridge & Civil Structures (skills & people) within Continental Europe.

volunteer_experiences.description:
The Concrete Association, jointly established in 1927 by the government and the business community, is the platform for individuals and organizations who want to share knowledge about the material concrete. Due to the composition of its members, it forms a knowledge infrastructure for acquiring knowledge, jointly recognizing knowledge questions and promoting the development of new knowledge about concrete. Through its activities, the Concrete Association supports its members with the knowledge they need in their daily professional practice.

The activities consist of:
providing permanent and incidental training from VMBO to university level. The level and quality of training is highly valued by the members, the organization of study days, excursions, workshops and exhibitions aimed at general and specific knowledge transfer, the publication of technical publications, the implementation of projects aimed at identifying and analyzing the knowledge demand , the support of the affiliated organizations, and finally general actions are also carried out to strengthen the position of the members or groups of members.

The basis of 800 collective members from the public and private domain and 1,000 personal members with a comparable background, approximately 12,500 persons are addressed directly. The knowledge that is offered is a welcome addition to the prior education and practical experience of our students.

Agent of Change: In 2018, the Dutch Safety Board (OVV) also called on the Governance Code for Safety in Construction (GCVB) to be an 'Agent of Change' in the field of safety. In 2019, proposals were developed together with the Opdrachtgeversforum, Bouwend Nederland, VN Constructeurs and Koninklijke NLIngenieurs (Core Coalition Safety) to improve the items for improvement mentioned by the OVV in its report 'Building structural safety'. The GCVB mainly focuses on the topics 'Directions on safety', 'Ensuring Structural Safety' and 'Learning Capacity'. These subjects pre-eminently require a chain approach.

Several communications items:
https://gc-veiligheid.nl/actueel/item/cooerdinerend-constructeur-moet-duidelijkheid-creeren-in-gefragmenteerde-bouw 
https://youtu.be/E95G0peUPc4

website:  https://veiligheidindebouw.nu/

volunteer_experiences.role: Member of the Board / algemeen bestuurslid
volunteer_experiences.description:
'Bouwen met Staal' is an association for all stakeholders and interested parties in the steel  construction industry. The Association has about 2,500 individual and corporate members and some 20 Gold Members. For the members the Association acts as a professional platform for sharing new knowledge and experience. 

To facilitate and stimulate this exchange the association organizes: 
•	Evening sessions at companies of our members;
•	Yearly symposium for and by steel manufacturers; 
•	Student Steel Award, the annual price for graduation work focused on steel 

‘Bouwen met Staal’ is actively promoting, advising, providing information, and stimulating research about the use and application of steel. Activities include: 
•	Education for steel engineering an drafting 
•	Courses and seminars
•	Tools for design, dimensioning and detailing
•	Publications of educational books
•	Publication of the bi-monthly trade magazine ‘Bouwen met Staal’ 
•	Biennial National Steel Award

Chair + Member of the Review Committee

The members of the review committee assess the applications for registration of structural engineers and designers in the Netherlands. The assessment for registration for structural engineers is an assessment of the data submitted on knowledge and experience. The members of the review committee conduct the assessment interviews with candidates for designers. The expulsion of members also belong to the tasks of the review committee.

The members of the review committee are top engineers / designers in their field.

http://www.constructeursregister.nl/info/organisatie/

volunteer_experiences.role: Member of the Board of Advisors
volunteer_experiences.description: AECTUAL combines design, engineering, bio materials and XL 3D digital production into one solution and platform. The Board of Advisors consists of Nigel Carr, Siert Wynia, and Sander den Blanken. Actual is a start-up that aims to provide a new digital supply chain from design to installment of 3D printed building components. AECTUAL is founded by the founders of DUS Architects. The global key partners of AECTUAL are HENKEL, Arup, Ultimaker and DUS. Furthermore there are several platform, research and public partners.
